edu.cpp.cs.cs141.gp

Class GameEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.gp.GameEngine

  • public class GameEngine
extends java.lang.Object
    This class runs the game. It calls the ActiveAgent, Briefcase, Enemy, Map, Player, PowerUp, and UserInterface classes to successfully run the game. It represents the communication among all of these classes to fulfill the setUp() and turn().
    Author:
    Pink Panthers

    • Field Detail

      • ui

        private UserInterface ui
        The following six fields create the objects by calling all of the classes.

      • theMap

        private Map theMap

      • theSpy

        private Player theSpy

      • theNinja

        private Enemy[] theNinja

      • theItem

        private PowerUp[] theItem

      • brief

        private Briefcase brief

      • outerMenu

        private boolean outerMenu
        This field may not have been necessary; however, it improved ease of use, especially since the main, or most frequently used, action to be used would be move. In any instance that the outer menu is not displayed, the user has the option to return to it. This is used in the playerTurn() method. If it is true, the outer menu is displayed; otherwise, it is skipped.

      • killedOnce

        private boolean killedOnce
        This field represents whether the theSpy has been killed during the enemies' turn, enemyAttack(int) and enemyTurn(). The purpose is to prevent multiple deaths (sometimes resulting in Game Over) in the same turn, which would occur when the player returns to the original spawning point and an enemy or enemies are on the spawning point or directly adjacent.

      • winGame

        private boolean winGame
        This boolean field is rather self-explanatory. If winGame is false, the theSpy has not yet found the diamond. It is only used and changed in turn() and playerMove(int).

      • hardMode

        private boolean hardMode
        If hardMode is true, theNinja will prioritize its movements according to the player. If it is false, theNinja will always move randomly. Consequently it is used only in enemyMoveSet(int) but is established in the beginning of a new game in setUp().

      • yourTurn

        private boolean yourTurn
        This field determines whether it is still the theSpy's turn, used in a loop for playerTurn() and can be changed in playerMove(int), which allows the player to have multiple actions if allowed. If the value is true, then it is still the player's turn, or else it is not the player's turn.

      • turnNumber

        private int turnNumber
        This integer field represents the number of turns taken so far. Originally it was used to test the loops, but it was nice to know the number of turns the player has taken, so it was kept. It is increased by one every turn().

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameEngine

        public GameEngine()

    • Method Detail

      • setUp

        public void setUp()
        This method displays the welcome text and the game menu. Depending on the selection in the first game menu, it creates theMap, sets theSpy, theItem, theNinja, and brief as well as the vision when a New Game is selected. Otherwise, it will load() the most recent save file of the game.

      • createNewGame

        public void createNewGame()
        This method creates a new instance of the game. It is used in setUp() and load() when loading is cancelled.

      • setItems

        public void setItems()
        This method makes theItem spawn into an array of three. It checks with theMap to find whether the square is taken already or not. If not, then the items are placed. If so, then the method continues to try to make possible spawning points.

      • setEnemies

        public void setEnemies()
        This method ensures that the enemies, theNinja, are properly placed on theMap. As with setItems(), it will continuously attempt to make new possible positions if it is not empty. Otherwise, it will place the enemy.

      • setBriefCase

        public void setBriefCase()
        This method sets brief on theMap in one of the nine rooms.

      • turn

        public void turn()
        This method represents the turns, looping the individual playerTurn() and enemyTurn(). The loop continues only if both of the following are true: theSpy still has lives and winGame is false. enemyTurn() only passes when the game has not been won yet. Vision is reestablished after both parties' turns end.

      • playerTurn

        public void playerTurn()
        This method lets theSpy take multiple actions in the outer and directional game menus. During the times that outerMenu is true, the user can select one of the following actions (and may repeat actions depending on the selection): (1) Move playerMove(int), (2) Shoot playerAttack(), (3) Look lookAction(), (4) Display Stats, (5) Toggle Debug, (6) Save the Game save(), (7) Quit, (8) View Key when debug mode is on. If (1) move is selected, playerMove(int) is passed with the user's inputed argument for direction. yourTurn is changed to false; as such, if the player chooses to move, that is the last move that the player may use. If (2) shoot is selected, and if there is ammo, playerAttack() is passed and the player will shoot; if not, the player will not shoot. yourTurn is changed to false; as such, if the player chooses to shoot, that is the last move the player may use. If (3) look is selected, the lookAction() is passed only if the user has not yet looked that turn. The user therefore may look once per turn, but may shoot or move after.

      • playerMove

        public void playerMove(int moveInput)
        This method lets the theSpy move and pick up items theItem by passing checkItems(int, int). It also lets the player check for the briefcase brief. If it's true, winGame is set to true, and the game will be terminated. Movement can only be achieved after theMap tells the GameEngine that it is okay for the player to move to the potential position. If it is okay, the player is moved and the previous position is reset to empty in theMap. yourTurn is set to false after the player successfully moves, or after the brief has been found.
        Parameters:
        moveInput - An integer value representing the desired direction for theSpy to move.

      • playerAttack

        public void playerAttack()
        This method represents theSpy's attack. It is passed by playerTurn() if the shoot action is selected. The method requests for the user to input the direction to shoot in and then sends it to playerShoot(int, int, int, int).

      • playerShoot

        public void playerShoot(int row,
                        int col,
                        int rowCheck,
                        int colCheck)
        This method is passed by playerAttack() and checks whether theSpy hit theNinja. Only the first (closest) enemy in the given direction of the player will be killed. When the player shoots, the ammo in his clip will reduce.
        Parameters:
        row - integer value of the player's row position
        col - integer value of the player's column position
        rowCheck - integer value of the amount to increase or decrease by, depending on the direction
        colCheck - integer value of the amount to increase or decrease by, depending on the direction

      • checkItems

        public void checkItems(int nextPlayerRow,
                       int nextPlayerCol)
        This method checks to see if theSpy will step on theItem. Once the player steps on the item, the appropriate effect will be triggered. It is passed in the playerMove(int) method.
        Parameters:
        nextPlayerRow - Integer value of the future row position of the player
        nextPlayerCol - Integer value of the future column position of the player

      • lookAction

        public void lookAction()
        If the player selected to look, the vision will increase by one increment in the desired direction on theMap, affecting the display for only that turn.

      • enemyTurn

        public void enemyTurn()
        This method is for the theNinjas' turns. The enemy can either move, using enemyMove(int) or enemyMoveSet(int), or attack, using enemyAttack(int). The loop to some extent (as the potential positions are randomly selected) prevents the enemy to waste a turn if it hits an adjacent non-passable object because of the loop. killedOnce is used in this method to prevent enemies from killing you more than once per the entire enemy party's turn. Furthermore, if the enemy spawns on theSpy's original position, the enemy will be moved to either north or east automatically, to give the user at least a fighting chance to survive.

      • enemyAttack

        public void enemyAttack(int enemyID)
        This method lets the game know what to do when theNinja stabs theSpy. If the spy is not invincible, then the appropriate theNinja will stab the theSpy. killedOnce will be changed to true, which will prevent multiple player deaths in one round of enemy turns. After being stabbed, theSpy is reset to the spawning point and its corresponding previous position on theMap is reset to empty. Furthermore, if the player has no more lives, the game will end.
        Parameters:
        enemyID - integer value for the array to call on the different enemies

      • enemyMoveSet

        public void enemyMoveSet(int enemyID)
        This method sets the movement for the enemies, and it passes enemyMove(int). If hardMode is true, then they will attempt to pursue theSpy until they either successfully kill the player or their 'Line-of-Sight' is broken.
        Parameters:
        enemyID - integer which identifies the enemy in an array

      • enemyMove

        public void enemyMove(int enemyID)
        The enemy is moved to the possible locations. This method is passed by enemyTurn() or enemyMoveSet(int). theNinja are placed on theMap, and the previous position of each is reset to empty on the map.
        Parameters:
        enemyID - is the index for the array that the specific enemy is found in

      • save

        public void save()
        This saves the game when the player selects this action in the method playerTurn(). It asks for the player's desired file name and then saves it to that.

      • load

        public void load()
        This method loads a given file instance of the game. The user must input an existing file. This method is selected during setUp().
